message: What do you guys think of it so far?

I have only been doing iOS dev for about two months, so I don't have that much of Xcode 3.2 under my belt. That said, I definitely prefer Xcode 4.0. Assistant, VCS integration, IB in the main window, the one-window paradigm itself... liking it!
Crashing less
Crashing a lot more for me.
Still I think it's a great improvement
yea...hopefully they have a patch to fix that soon
The real treat is git integration...
@davmendels yea.. I really like that
been using it for a month now and it crashes more than XCode 3
It's great but GOD it's slow and so much different than the old xCode. I sort of like the simpler approach better....
coming from XCode 3 it seems like a bit steeper of a learning curve than I would've expected
Quite enjoying Xcode 4, though Interface Builder integration is a little confusing at first.
It crashes way too much for my liking.  Still feels beta quality.  I expected better.  Apple have thrown a lot of work into the toolchain, but they seem to be neglecting the user-facing parts of it.
I do quite agree. Though I haven't been crashing it that much. My real problems are with 4.1 under Lion, which has done strange stuff on my nibs
My Xcode always crashes if I try to create an static nsstring, like @"string". It crashes right after I click the " key.
Get used with it - there is no way back. 4.1 and 4.2 are way more stable than 4.0.x.
Something is wrong about your XCode installation. XCode4 has come a long way and it's a much better tool than 3. Also, 4.1 and 4.2 are more stable than 4.0.x.
Xcode 4 is the shiiit. Way better than previous versions. :)
@RomanRobot it crashes too often for me

It's crashed a few times for me, not frequent enough to be annoying though. You can save after it crashes if you click continue and let it crash after. Either way, the benefits far outweigh everything else. I'm loving everything about it. It's like Microsoft word compared to Notepad (previous versions of Xcode).
Liking it
